dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, everyone's always talking about Jeff Bezos, right? Like, the richest man in the world, his net worth is just insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, everyone's always talking about Jeff Bezos, right? Like, the richest man in the world, his net worth is just insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of Thursday (the 16th of August), hes worth nearly $156 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally! Uh, I think he was like, almost $156 billion just recently? Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally! Uh, I think he was like, almost one hundred fifty six billion dollars just recently? Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of Thursday (the 16th of August), hes worth nearly $156 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But here's the kicker, Host_B. The Walton family, the Walmart heirs? They're *still* considerably wealthier.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But here's the kicker, Host_B. The Walton family, the Walmart heirs? They're still considerably wealthier.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the heirs of Walmart founder Sam Walton together are still considerably wealthier, thanks in part to a stock bump after Walmarts latest quarterly earnings report. ... Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No way! [interrupts] Really? Even with Amazon's stock just, like, sky-rocketing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! Really? Even with Amazon's stock just, like, sky-rocketing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep! Thanks to a stock bump after Walmart's latest quarterly earnings. I mean, as of that Thursday, they were collectively worth about $174 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep! Thanks to a stock bump after Walmart's latest quarterly earnings. I mean, as of that Thursday, they were collectively worth about one hundred seventy four billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a huge difference! So, uh, Walmart's really holding its own then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a huge difference! So, uh, Walmart's really holding its own then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Their earnings report totally pleased Wall Street, sending their stock up nearly ten percent in one day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Their earnings report totally pleased Wall Street, sending their stock up nearly ten percent in one day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ten percent! That's massive. So, wait, how much did that add to their collective fortune, like, in a single day?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ten percent! That's massive. So, wait, how much did that add to their collective fortune, like, in a single day?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Host_B, it was a cool $13 billion. Just on that Thursday!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Host_B, it was a cool thirteen billion dollars. Just on that Thursday!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Thirteen *billion*? In one day? Goodness. And I heard this also meant Alice Walton, Sam Walton's daughter, um, she reclaimed a title, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thirteen billion? In one day? Goodness. And I heard this also meant Alice Walton, Sam Walton's daughter, um, she reclaimed a title, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: She did! Richest woman in the world again, with $46 billion. She beat out L'Oréal's heiress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She did! Richest woman in the world again, with forty six billion dollars. She beat out L'Oréal's heiress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's pretty impressive. And her brothers, Jim and Rob, they're like, still in the top 20 nationally too, I think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's pretty impressive. And her brothers, Jim and Rob, they're like, still in the top twenty nationally too, I think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, exactly. But what's really making Walmart tick, especially against Amazon, is their expanded online catalog and their rapid grocery business growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, exactly. But what's really making Walmart tick, especially against Amazon, is their expanded online catalog and their rapid grocery business growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the grocery war! [interrupts] I mean, Amazon bought Whole Foods, right? That's gotta be tough competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the grocery war! I mean, Amazon bought Whole Foods, right? That's gotta be tough competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It is, but Walmart's pushing hard. Their grocery delivery service is gonna be in 40% of America by the end of the year, and pickup's already in like, 1,800 locations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is, but Walmart's pushing hard. Their grocery delivery service is gonna be in forty percent of America by the end of the year, and pickup's already in like, eighteen hundred locations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's really smart. I mean, for all the talk about e-commerce, people still need groceries, right? And Walmart's just, like, a master of logistics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's really smart. I mean, for all the talk about e-commerce, people still need groceries, right? And Walmart's just, like, a master of logistics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And if they keep this up, Host_B, our estimates suggest they could be the first $200 billion family in history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And if they keep this up, Host_B, our estimates suggest they could be the first two hundred billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Walmart keeps this up, the Waltons may soon cross a threshold that absolutely no one else has. By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. The first. That's, um, that's just mind-blowing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. The first. That's, um, that's just mind-blowing.
